trans-unit.source: Manage Hadoop clusters using Azure CLI | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Manage Hadoop clusters using Azure CLI | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: How to use the Azure CLI to manage Hadoop clusters in HDIsight
trans-unit.target: How to use the Azure CLI to manage Hadoop clusters in HDIsight

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use the Azure CLI to manage Hadoop clusters in Azure HDInsight.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use the Azure CLI to manage Hadoop clusters in Azure HDInsight.

trans-unit.source: The Azure CLI is implemented in Node.js.
trans-unit.target: The Azure CLI is implemented in Node.js.

trans-unit.source: It can be used on any platform that supports Node.js, including Windows, Mac, and Linux.
trans-unit.target: It can be used on any platform that supports Node.js, including Windows, Mac, and Linux.

trans-unit.source: The Azure CLI is open source.
trans-unit.target: The Azure CLI is open source.

trans-unit.source: The source code is managed in GitHub at https://github.com/azure/azure-xplat-cli.
trans-unit.target: The source code is managed in GitHub at https://github.com/azure/azure-xplat-cli.

trans-unit.source: This article covers only using the Azure CLI with HDInsight.
trans-unit.target: This article covers only using the Azure CLI with HDInsight.

trans-unit.source: For a general guide on how to use Azure CLI, see <linkText>How to use the Azure CLI[azure-command-line-tools]</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For a general guide on how to use Azure CLI, see <linkText>How to use the Azure CLI[azure-command-line-tools]</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Before you begin this article, you must have the following:
trans-unit.target: Before you begin this article, you must have the following:

trans-unit.source: An Azure subscription.
trans-unit.target: An Azure subscription.

trans-unit.source: See <linkText>Get Azure free trial</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: See <linkText>Get Azure free trial</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Azure CLI - See Install and configure the Azure CLI for installation and configuration information.
trans-unit.target: Azure CLI - See Install and configure the Azure CLI for installation and configuration information.

trans-unit.source: If you have not already done so, use the <linkText>Install and configure the Azure CLI</linkText><title></title> document to install and configure the Azure CLI.
trans-unit.target: If you have not already done so, use the <linkText>Install and configure the Azure CLI</linkText><title></title> document to install and configure the Azure CLI.

trans-unit.source: HDInsight uses an Azure Blob storage container as the default file system.
trans-unit.target: HDInsight uses an Azure Blob storage container as the default file system.

trans-unit.source: An Azure Storage account is required before you can create an HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: An Azure Storage account is required before you can create an HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: After you have imported the publishsettings file, you can use the following command to create a Storage account:
trans-unit.target: After you have imported the publishsettings file, you can use the following command to create a Storage account:

trans-unit.source: The Storage account must be collocated with HDInsight in the data center.
trans-unit.target: The Storage account must be collocated with HDInsight in the data center.

trans-unit.source: For information on creating an Azure Storage account by using the Azure preview portal, see <linkText>Create, manage, or delete a Storage account[azure-create-storageaccount]</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For information on creating an Azure Storage account by using the Azure preview portal, see <linkText>Create, manage, or delete a Storage account[azure-create-storageaccount]</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: If you already have a Storage account but do not know the account name and account key, you can use the following commands to retrieve the information:
trans-unit.target: If you already have a Storage account but do not know the account name and account key, you can use the following commands to retrieve the information:

trans-unit.source: For details on getting the information by using the Azure preview portal, see the "View, copy, and regenerate storage access keys" section of <linkText>Create, manage, or delete a Storage account[azure-create-storageaccount]</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For details on getting the information by using the Azure preview portal, see the "View, copy, and regenerate storage access keys" section of <linkText>Create, manage, or delete a Storage account[azure-create-storageaccount]</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The azure hdinsight cluster create command creates the container if it doesn't exist.
trans-unit.target: The azure hdinsight cluster create command creates the container if it doesn't exist.

trans-unit.source: If you choose to create the container beforehand, you can use the following command:
trans-unit.target: If you choose to create the container beforehand, you can use the following command:

trans-unit.source: Once you have the Storage account and the Blob container prepared, you are ready to create a cluster:
trans-unit.target: Once you have the Storage account and the Blob container prepared, you are ready to create a cluster:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>HDI.CLIClusterCreation</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>HDI.CLIClusterCreation</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Typically, you provision an HDInsight cluster, run jobs on it, and then delete the cluster to cut down the cost.
trans-unit.target: Typically, you provision an HDInsight cluster, run jobs on it, and then delete the cluster to cut down the cost.

trans-unit.source: The command-line interface gives you the option to save the configurations into a file, so that you can reuse it every time you provision a cluster.
trans-unit.target: The command-line interface gives you the option to save the configurations into a file, so that you can reuse it every time you provision a cluster.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>HDI.CLIClusterCreationConfig</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>HDI.CLIClusterCreationConfig</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Use the following commands to list and show cluster details:
trans-unit.target: Use the following commands to list and show cluster details:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>HDI.CLIListCluster</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>HDI.CLIListCluster</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Use the following command to delete a cluster:
trans-unit.target: Use the following command to delete a cluster:

trans-unit.target: In this article, you have learned how to perform different HDInsight cluster administrative tasks.
